page.title: 04Buildings.
page.content: Our area has approximately 328 buildings.A mixture of modern and older properties are spaced out along the Petworth,Wisborough Green and Plaistow roads.They belong to three periods.The first is the end of the 16th early 17th century which includes most of the old houses.They are found around the church and show signs of a timber framed structure.Six have Horsham stone roofs.The second building period is that of the 18th century when some of the larger estate buildings were constructed.The third period is since 1945 when Townfield estate originally all council owned and others privately owned houses, flats and bungalows were built. All the houses in the area have gardens which are well looked after. Electricity,mains drainage came to the village at this time.
